Class ChatServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ChatServer
  • public class ChatServer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the multi-threaded server.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicInteger clientID
      AtomicInteger representing the ID that should be assigned to the next client that joins
      private java.util.Vector<ServerClientHandler> clientThreadVector
      Vector storing ServerClientHandler threads representing the clients
      private java.net.ServerSocket mySocket
      ServerSocket representing the server which is used to accept the client connections
      private java.lang.Boolean serverShutDown
      Boolean representing whether the server is being closed

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ChatServer​(java.lang.String consolePort)
      The constructor initialises mySocket (after validation).

        Vector storing ServerClientHandler threads representing the clients

        AtomicInteger representing the ID that should be assigned to the next client that joins

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChatServer

        public ChatServer​(java.lang.String consolePort)
        The constructor initialises mySocket (after validation).
        Parameters:
        consolePort - String representing the port number entered into the console (default is "14001" if none was entered)

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method, creates an instance of ChatServer using console arguments as input for portString ("14001" as default) and calls the go method
        Parameters:
        args - arguments received from commandline

      • createServerSocket

        private void createServerSocket​(java.lang.String portString)
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Attempts connecting to the server given the portString supplied.
        Parameters:
        portString - String representing the port supplied
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs when opening the socket
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the port number is not an integer between 1024 and 65535

      • go

        public void go()
        This method is called once the server is initialised which is how the server should run.

      • acceptClient

        private void acceptClient()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This method is responsible for accepting clients to the server and creating a thread that handles with their requests
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the server is closed gracefully

      • dealWithClientMsg

        public void dealWithClientMsg​(int senderID,
                              MessageType messageType,
                              java.lang.String message)
        Forwards the client's message to the correct method depending on the message type
        Parameters:
        senderID - int representing the sender client's ID
        messageType - MessageType representing the message's type
        message - String representing the message to be sent

      • sendClientDoDInfo

        private void sendClientDoDInfo​(java.lang.String message)
        Forwards the message from DoD to the correct client
        Parameters:
        message - String representing the client ID and message to be sent, separated by a space

      • DoDMetaData

        private void DoDMetaData​(java.lang.String message)
        Changes the correct client's mode to broadcast mode if the game is over
        Parameters:
        message - String representing the client ID and whether the game is over, separated by a space

      • clientBroadcast

        private void clientBroadcast​(java.lang.String message)
        This method forwards the message to all clients which are not in a DoD game and all chatBots.
        Parameters:
        message - String containing the client's message

      • botBroadcast

        private void botBroadcast​(java.lang.String message)
        This method forwards the message to all ChatClients which are not in a DoD game. The message is not sent to the chatBots intentionally as the bots do not need to respond to their own messages, only to the clients
        Parameters:
        message - String containing the client's message

      • forwardMsgToDoDClient

        private void forwardMsgToDoDClient​(java.lang.String message)
        This method forwards the message sent by the client to the DoDClient
        Parameters:
        message - String containing the client's message

      • createNewDoDGame

        private void createNewDoDGame​(int clientID)
        This method attempts to create a new game in the DoDClient corresponding with the client ID given. The client is then updated to be in DoD mode, which means they will not receive broadcasts.
        Parameters:
        clientID - int representing the client's ID

      • removeClientFromDoD

        private void removeClientFromDoD​(int clientID)
        This method ends a client's DoD game in the DoDClient given the client's ID.
        Parameters:
        clientID - int representing the client's ID

      • removeClient

        public void removeClient​(int clientID)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method removes a client from the server cleanly given the client's ID.
        Parameters:
        clientID - int representing the client's ID
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If socket fails to close

      • handleDoDModeClients

        private void handleDoDModeClients()
        Returns all clients in DoD mode to broadcast mode

      • getThreadFromID

        private ServerClientHandler getThreadFromID​(int clientID)
        Returns the ServerClientHandler corresponding with the client's ID
        Parameters:
        clientID - int representing the client's ID
        Returns:
        ServerClientHandler representing the instance of ServerClientHandler corresponding with the client's ID

      • findFirstDoDClient

        private ServerClientHandler findFirstDoDClient()
        Returns the ServerClientHandler corresponding with the first DoDClient on the server
        Returns:
        ServerClientHandler representing the instance of ServerClientHandler corresponding with the first DoDClient

      • checkFirstDoDThread

        private void checkFirstDoDThread​(int clientID)
        Checks to see whether the client is another (i.e. not the first) DoDClient on the server. If so then they are removed from the server.
        Parameters:
        clientID - int representing the client's ID

      • cleanShutDown

        public void cleanShutDown()
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          java.lang.InterruptedException
        Shuts down the server cleanly, closing all the client sockets and the server sockets
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs when closing the socket
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If a thread did not join
